text: you want a nice brunch dish or something
for tea or coffee in the afternoon or
maybe a slightly Swedish thing to go for
dinner what could be better than whole
wheat sawdust muffins just like Grandma
starchild from Schrader Street and the
Haight used to make I don't really mean
the part about the sawdust but the point
is that you can make muffins with almost
anything you want and what we're gonna
do here today is make real whole-wheat
muffins that are light delicious and not
like grandma starchild used to make the
important thing or one important thing
is to start with whole wheat pastry
flour which is available more or less
anywhere these days so this is two and a
half cups of whole wheat pastry flour
3/4 a cup of sugar 2 teaspoons baking
powder half a teaspoon baking soda we
could get into the chemistry of that
some other time and a half a teaspoon of
salt so those are your dry ingredients
just mix that together lightly and now
you know a lot of flexibility and
recipes that I do obviously but here you
want to get the dry ingredients right
this is a cup of mashed banana use ripe
banana just mash it up this is this
mashed banana was my sawdust joke
you can put pretty much anything you
want in this part of the recipe so
grated apple or zucchini or carrot or
anything like that this is where you can
add walnuts coconut sunflower seeds this
is the way you can add spices like
ginger or clover allspice any of those
kind of sweet warm spices cinnamon this
you have a ton of options here here's
another place where you have an option
this is buttermilk and it's good
buttermilk as you can see because it's
pretty thick you can use half a cup of
yogurt many options here you could use
juices for that matter and it's thick of
melted butter as I said these are not
diet muffins these get beaten together
in no particular way nicely mixed and
now
the idea is to swiftly and lightly mix
the wet ingredients and the dry you
don't want to over develop the gluten
that's in the flour so get the wet
ingredients in there and like pancake
batter like quick bread you want to
distribute the liquid ingredients in
there but you don't want to beat this to
death you still see some flour that's
okay so this will make 12 muffins you
want to fill these liners fairly high
because these don't rise a lot and I
know they look if you're used to making
muffins I know they look kind of dense
you don't have to use liners you can use
a greased muffin tin or you could even
rely on the no stick properties of a
muffin tin
I like liners and you know then you can
open a little bakery like Grandma star
child in the Haight or maybe Shattuck
Avenue in Berkeley or Madison Wisconsin
I hear the rents are OK in the village
these days I like to mash banana into
the oven 375 check them in 20 minutes
they might take as long as 30 very heavy
these took about 25 minutes and you can
tell they're done well you could see
they're done but if you're not that
experienced you can tell they're done
because you insert a paring knife or any
thin bladed object and it comes out
clean there's no wet batter on there
they rose beautifully they smell great
you can smell the butter in them like I
said these are not diet muffins I made
some before too these are the famous
grandma star shine sawdust muffins
actually these are pumpkin muffins and
as I said for that banana puree is
pretty much any sort of mushy liquid
ingredient you want you can use pumpkin
squash butternut squash is really great
here applesauce as I said but back to
our banana
gorgeous this is all about lightness the
incredible lightness of muffin
